turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Hello? Hi. Um, should we start? Yeah, okay. <UNSURE>Hello how</UNSURE> um. Good morning sir, how can I help you this morning?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Hello, how are you?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Oh</UNSURE> <UNSURE>hey</UNSURE>, um, I've just had some diarrhea for the last three days, um, and it's been affecting me I need to stay close to the toilet. And, um, yeah, it's been affecting my day-to-day activities.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> Sorry to hear that. Um, and and when you say diarrhea, what'd you mean by diarrhea? Do you mean you're going to the toilet more often? Or are your stools more loose?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, so it's like loose and watery stool, going to the toilet quite often, uh and like some pain in my, like, lower stomach?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay. And how many times a day are you going, let's say, in the last couple of days?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Um</UNSURE>, probably like six or seven times a day? Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Six, seven times a day. And you <UNIN/> mention it's mainly watery. Have you noticed any other things, like blood in your stools?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No, no blood, yeah, just watery and loose stool.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay. And you mentioned you've had some pain in your tummy as well. <UNIN/> Whereabouts is the pain, exactly?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: So <UNIN/> in my lower abdomen, so, uh, like, um...yeah, just to one side.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: One side. <UNSURE>And</UNSURE> what side is that?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, on the left side.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Left side. Okay, and can you describe the pain to me?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, it feels, um, like a cramp, like a muscular cramp, and, um, yeah i feel a bit uh weak and shaky.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay. And is the pain, is that, is it there all the time, or does it come and go?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, it comes and goes.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Come</UNSURE> and go. Does the pain move anywhere else, for example towards your back?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh...no, just maybe my stomach.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay, fine. And you mentioned you've been feeling quite weak and shaky as well. What do you mean by shaky? Do you mean you've been having, uh have you been feeling feverish, for example?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yeah</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah, it doesn't feel like -- yeah, it just <UNSURE>makes</UNSURE> me feel weak. I haven't had a fever, um, at the moment, but I did notice um a temperature when the symptoms started, so, um, yeah around about three or four days ago.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>You</UNSURE> measure your temperature then?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, I <UNSURE>uh</UNSURE> I didn't mention my temperature, no, but I felt, um, just a bit hot. <UNSURE>And</UNSURE>, <UNSURE>y'know</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay. Okay. Any other symptoms like sweating, or um, night <UNSURE>sweats</UNSURE>? No? And, uh, any vomiting at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, so um, I vomited at the start of the symptoms but now um I've stopped vomiting.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>You</UNSURE> stopped vomiting, okay. And was your vomit, I know it's not <UNSURE>a nice thing</UNSURE> to talk about, but was it just normal food colour <UNIN/> Yeah. And there was no blood in your vomit, is that right?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, yeah, just normal vomit, yeah. No no <UNSURE>blood</UNSURE>, no. Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, okay. Um, and um, any any other symptoms at all? So you mentioned tummy pain, you mentioned diarrhea, you mentioned your vomiting, uh, anything else that comes to mind?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep. Um, I had a loss of appetite, um, so I haven't been eating as much, but I've been able to hold down fluids.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> Okay.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay, so you're drinking fluids. Um, what kind of foods have you managed to eat, <UNSURE>if</UNSURE> anything?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, just soups, and, uh, yeah, light foods. Like smoothies and, yeah, liquid foods mainly.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay. Fine. Um, and sir <UNIN/> <UNSURE>these</UNSURE> started three days ago the symptoms. <UNSURE>Are you</UNSURE> aware of any triggers which may have caused the <UNSURE>symptoms</UNSURE> uh to kick on. So <UNSURE>for</UNSURE> example, <UNSURE>think like</UNSURE> takeaway foods or eating out or <UNSURE>being</UNSURE> around other people <UNSURE>with</UNSURE> similar symptoms.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah, so I had takeaway about four days ago, um, <UNSURE>uh</UNSURE>, but other than that I've, yeah, been, uh, eating normally. Nothing unusual here.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Okay</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Do you remember <UNSURE>where</UNSURE> you ate?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah, I <UNIN/> ate at a Chinese restaurant with friends. Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay. Anyone else unwell with similar <UNSURE>symptoms</UNSURE>?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, so no one else in the family, so <UNIN/> a wife and two kids and one, um, child was vomiting, but they haven't got diarrhea. There's no one with the same symptoms.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay, okay. Fine. Um, alright. And uh, in terms of your <UNIN/>, your overall health, are you normally <UNSURE>fit and</UNSURE> well? Or, uh

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, yeah, I mean, other than um athsma, um I use an inhaler, everything uh else is fine.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay. And, is your asthma well-controlled?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, that's fine. I just, yeah, use an inhaler, and uh that's under control.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fine. And you don't have any other tummy problem, bowel problems I should be aware of?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No, okay. Um, and <UNIN/> apart from the inhalers, do you take any other medications?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, no other medications.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Okay</UNSURE>, fine. And in terms of just your day to day life, you said it's been affecting your life, um, in what way has it been affecting your life?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, so, I need to stay close to the toilet 'cause I go quite frequently during the these past three days. Um, yeah, other than that, it's uh, yeah, the main concern.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And have you, are you currently working at the moment? <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, <UNSURE>yes</UNSURE>, yeah. I I work, er. Um, I'm an accountant.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Would, would</UNSURE> work.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay. Have you been going into work the last three days, or <UNSURE>have you</UNSURE> been at home?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, yeah, I've been going to work. Yeah. Yeah, it's been quite difficult.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> <UNSURE>okay</UNSURE>. That must be difficult for you then.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> <UNSURE>fine</UNSURE>. And you said, you mentioned you live with your wife and two children, is that right?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yes, yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Right</UNSURE>, alright. Um, just <UNSURE>a</UNSURE> couple of other question we need to ask, <UNSURE>sir</UNSURE>. Um, do you smoke at all?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, I don't smoke.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: And do you drink much in the way of alcohol?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, no, I I don't drink alcohol, no. <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay. <UNIN/> so um, er normally at this stage I like to um, examine you if that's okay, but um, um, but but having listened to your story, sir, I think uh, um, just to recap <UNIN/> for the last three days you've been having loose stool, diarrhea, a bit of tummy pain uh mainly on the left-hand side, um and <UNIN/> vomiting and <UNSURE>fever and</UNSURE> you're quite weak and lethargic um, you mentioned you had this Chinese takeaway as <UNSURE>little as</UNSURE> three days ago and I wondered whether that might be the cause of your problems.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, it seems like you may have something, uh, called gastroenteritis, which essentially just a tummy bug or infection of your <UNSURE>uh</UNSURE> of your tummy.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Uh, mainly caused by viruses but there can be a possibility of bacteria uh causing <UNSURE>its</UNSURE> symptoms. Um.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: At this stage, uh, what, what we'd recommend is just what we <UNSURE>say</UNSURE> conservative management. So, um, I don't think you need anything like antibiotics. It's really just, um, making sure you're well hydrated, so drinking fluids.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Mm-hmm.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, <UNIN/> there are things like Dioralyte you can get from the pharmacy, which uh it's um it helps helps replenish your minerals and vitamins.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, and if you are having vomiting diarrhea I <UNSURE>would say</UNSURE> recommend <UNSURE>that</UNSURE> in the first, you know, first couple of days.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> If you are feeling feverish and weak, <UNSURE>eh</UNSURE> taking some paracetamol, uh, <UNIN/> two tablets up to four times a day for the first few days can also help.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNSURE>Yep</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I <UNSURE>will</UNSURE> certainly advise you to take some time <UNSURE>off</UNSURE> work, <UNSURE>actually</UNSURE> I know you're quite keen to work but I would say the next two, two to three days as <UNSURE>the infection</UNSURE> clears from your system to take some time off and rest.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, <UNSURE>I'll admit</UNSURE> if your symptoms haven't got better, you know, in in three to four days, <UNSURE>I'd</UNSURE> like to come and see you again. <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Okay, <UNSURE>sure</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Because if it is ongoing then we have to wonder whether something else <UNSURE>caused</UNSURE> your symptoms.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNSURE>Uh</UNSURE>, and we may need to do further <UNSURE>tests</UNSURE> like um taking a sample of your stool so we can test that.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: <UNIN/>

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Um, etcetera etcetera.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Yep, sure, yep.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: How's that sound?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: That sounds great, yeah. Yeah.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> Do you have any questions for me?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Um, no, no further questions, <UNSURE>no</UNSURE>.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Okay, and is uh is the treatment plan clear?

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Uh, <UNSURE>yes</UNSURE>, yeah, that's that's very clear. Thank you.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Great. Well, I wish you all the best.

turns.speaker: PATIENT
turns.text: Okay, thank you. Bye.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: <UNIN/> Thank you. <UNSURE>Bye bye</UNSURE>.
